Yeah, I can see the stutter in the sample. It is not terrible, but it is annoying . . . But why is it there? Does it have to do with a 3-D version being converted into a 2-D version -- dropping frames incorrectly? Or an underpowered PC somewhere in the mix of doing the transcoding and dropping frames?

No matter what some selfproclamed lunatics write, this verion of Avatar is worthwhile to sit down with a few nice drinks and watch.

Do we really need an IMDB link for this one?

Thanks to raymondhome for uploading this. Again, though, about the stutter, I seem to recall that even during the showing at the theater, I could see stutter. This was at a digital IMAX version. It bothered me then too. Some scenes have no stutter, especially those with no CG. Others though, especially heavily-CG ones with lots of motion, the characters do jump from one position to the next seemingly skipping several frames that should have been rendered.
